alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 10:59PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Newton, southern Kemper and Lauderdale Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1058 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Herbert Springs to 7 miles southwest of Duffee to 6 miles northeast of Garlandville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Duffee around 1105 PM CST. Suqualena and Martin around 1110 PM CST. Meridian, Nellieburg and Meehan around 1115 PM CST. Prismatic and Savoy around 1120 PM CST. Daleville around 1125 PM CST. Meridian Station, Marion and Zero around 1130 PM CST. Lauderdale, Toomsuba, Tamola and Increase around 1140 PM CST. Kewanee around 1145 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for east central Mississippi.
